title: What is wrong with ranked?
body:
I just played my 2 first ranked matches today. I was expecting a similar level of players that I get in normals but instead I got matched up with players way above my ELO. My ADC was gold and probably the best ADC I have ever played with. I keep letting my team down because I can't make plays at this level.

Should I wait a few days for Riot Match making to sort my ELO out?

replies.body:
There are a few things to consider in this situation.
1. If it's the first time you've played ranked your initial MMR will be around Silver 5.
2. It is entirely possible for an individual to have an MMR that is an entire division below their rank. What this means is that it's possible for someone with a rank of Gold 5 to have an MMR at the level of Silver 5.
3. As Fog has already mentioned, people are pooled closer at the start of each season.

A little bit of advice, listen to what Knuuckles has said. You don't need to know their ranks, in fact it will probably intimidate you if they are ranked higher than you despite the chances of them having the same or lower MMR than you. If you do want to know their ranks wait until the end of the match, that way gameplay wont be affected by it.
At the samw time, he has only mentioned the rankings of one person on his team. Maybe he is looking at his team's borders and thinking "Damn, everyone in the game is higher than me."
just don't search them up your psyching yourself out before the game even starts, just play your game

Abuse it. Rank as much as possible because you will be getting experiance and heaps of it. You'll see how they act and how they cs, when they poke and when they back off. If I got que'd against diamond players I would want to play all day. 

10 games at a higher elo and you will be much better for it already

Wait it out. When a season starts players are pooled in closer to each other in terms of MMR which means players from different elos can end up in the same game. After the first month or so the players are all split back up into their rightful tiers. The ones that are good enough to get out are back in higher divisions and less capable players are placed in lower divisions.
Oh right. I think I'll wait for the next patch to play again, it still kinda sucks though.
